title: Tip
content: BPH reproduces faster once it has been exposed to pesticides.

title: Tip
content: There are usually fewer spiders than wasps, but predators like spiders consume more pests.

title: Tip
content: Some BPH are immune to pesticides, using pesticides only kills the non-immune BPH.

title: Tip
content: Parasitoids like wasps kill BPH by laying their eggs inside them. The wasp larvae then consume the BPH from the inside out.

title: Tip
content: Once you remove all the layers of rice the BPH has damaged, the game will advance to the next week

title: Tip
content: Wolf spiders can bite humans, but their bite is not dangerous

title: Tip
content: When pesticides are mixed together, they harm more bugs that could attack the target pest instead

title: Tip
content: Not all insects are pests. Some insects are natural enemies of pests.

title: Tip
content: Perilla flower is a natural repellent for BPH.

title: Tip
content: Every week, some BPH will reproduce, some will die, and some will migrate in your field

title: Tip
content: The best methods to defend against bio agressors are preventive ones
